info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 8:38AM EDT until April 13 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...
Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton and Sussex Counties.
For the Chowan Basin...including Franklin at US Highway 58/258, Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water begins to cover Old Forty Road, State Route 634, in Sussex County. Additionally, Peters Bridge boat landing and portions of the Chub Sandhill Natural Area Preserve begin to flood, approximately 5 miles upstream of gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EDT Saturday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and will continue to fall to 14.9 feet by early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 01/06/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
